intro: Talauma peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular talauma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Talauma peninsularis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
